title: Why the happiest country can't stop greening
Bus crash near French ski resort kills two, injures 33
content: A deadly bus accident near France's Porte-Puymorens ski resort resulted in the death of at least two people and injuries to 33 others, with seven critically injured. The bus, carrying 47 passengers, struck a cliff for reasons still under investigation. Rescue operations included over 120 personnel from France, Andorra, and Spain.
summary: A deadly bus accident near France's Porte-Puymorens ski resort resulted in the death of at least two people and injuries to 33 others, with seven critically injured. The bus, carrying 47 passengers, struck a cliff for reasons still under investigation. Rescue operations included over 120 personnel from France, Andorra, and Spain.

title: DOGE duo of Musk and Ramaswamy criticise 'deep state' bureaucracy
content: Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy criticized 'deep state' bureaucracy following MSNBC's comments on Kash Patel, labeling it a threat to democracy. Musk and Ramaswamy will lead the Department of Government Efficiency under Trump, aiming to reform federal bureaucracy and reduce wasteful spending by 2026.
summary: Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy criticized 'deep state' bureaucracy following MSNBC's comments on Kash Patel, labeling it a threat to democracy. Musk and Ramaswamy will lead the Department of Government Efficiency under Trump, aiming to reform federal bureaucracy and reduce wasteful spending by 2026.

title: Bangladesh HC acquits Zia’s son in 2004 grenade attack cases
‘Virtually zero risk’: Rabies expert questions killing of pet squirrel Peanut
content: The New York State DEC euthanised popular pet squirrel P’Nut and rescued raccoon Fred, sparking criticism from experts and animal rights advocates. Despite quarantine alternatives, the animals were killed for rabies testing following a questionable bite incident. Mark Longo, their caretaker, had been working to secure permits. Legal action and public outrage have ensued over the controversial act.
summary: The New York State DEC euthanised popular pet squirrel P’Nut and rescued raccoon Fred, sparking criticism from experts and animal rights advocates. Despite quarantine alternatives, the animals were killed for rabies testing following a questionable bite incident. Mark Longo, their caretaker, had been working to secure permits. Legal action and public outrage have ensued over the controversial act.

title: 'Willingness to lie to govt': Vivek Ramaswamy criticises US immigration system
content: Vivek Ramaswamy criticizes the US immigration system for rewarding dishonesty over genuine asylum claims. He stresses the need for reform, echoing Trump’s policies on securing borders and enforcing the rule of law. Ramaswamy emphasizes lawful entry and opposes benefits for undocumented immigrants.
summary: Vivek Ramaswamy criticizes the US immigration system for rewarding dishonesty over genuine asylum claims. He stresses the need for reform, echoing Trump’s policies on securing borders and enforcing the rule of law. Ramaswamy emphasizes lawful entry and opposes benefits for undocumented immigrants.

title: Elon Musk backs call for transparency after Kash Patel's FBI appointment
content: President-elect Donald Trump appoints Kash Patel as FBI Director, prompting social media calls for the declassification of contentious documents such as the 'Epstein list' and 'Diddy list.' Elon Musk supports the push for transparency, aligning with Patel's advocacy for revealing sensitive information for public accountability.
summary: President-elect Donald Trump appoints Kash Patel as FBI Director, prompting social media calls for the declassification of contentious documents such as the 'Epstein list' and 'Diddy list.' Elon Musk supports the push for transparency, aligning with Patel's advocacy for revealing sensitive information for public accountability.

title: Prince William's equerry Rob Dixon steps down after four years of service
content: Lieutenant Commander Rob Dixon leaves his position as Prince William’s equerry after four years. Appointed in September 2020, Dixon facilitated several significant royal events. He returns to the Royal Navy, making way for Squadron Leader Mike Reynolds to assume the role.
summary: Lieutenant Commander Rob Dixon leaves his position as Prince William’s equerry after four years. Appointed in September 2020, Dixon facilitated several significant royal events. He returns to the Royal Navy, making way for Squadron Leader Mike Reynolds to assume the role.

title: Prince William finds solace in Ella’s company to escape Middleton family games
content: Prince William avoids the intense competitiveness of Middleton family game nights by taking James Middleton's dog, Ella, for a walk. Although William enjoys challenging Kate in private, he prefers to cheer from the sidelines during family games. William's love for animals and integration into the Middleton family highlight his close bond with them.
summary: Prince William avoids the intense competitiveness of Middleton family game nights by taking James Middleton's dog, Ella, for a walk. Although William enjoys challenging Kate in private, he prefers to cheer from the sidelines during family games. William's love for animals and integration into the Middleton family highlight his close bond with them.

title: Is Stephan Hawking’s ‘gigantic ball of fire’ prediction about Earth coming true?
content: Physicist Stephen Hawking's predictions about Earth's future resurface as NASA warns of existential threats like climate change and overpopulation. Hawking urged action to colonize other planets to ensure humanity's survival, highlighting climate change, nuclear war, pandemics, AI, and asteroid impacts as key dangers. NASA emphasizes urgent action to mitigate irreversible climate damage.
summary: Physicist Stephen Hawking's predictions about Earth's future resurface as NASA warns of existential threats like climate change and overpopulation. Hawking urged action to colonize other planets to ensure humanity's survival, highlighting climate change, nuclear war, pandemics, AI, and asteroid impacts as key dangers. NASA emphasizes urgent action to mitigate irreversible climate damage.

title: Syrian government loses control of second-largest city Aleppo for first time in 13 years of civil war
content: Government forces lost control of Aleppo to the Islamist-dominated rebel alliance for the first time since the conflict began in 2011. The lightning assault was led by Hayat Tahrir al-Sham and coincided with a ceasefire in Lebanon. Kurdish forces expanded their control, exacerbating tensions with the rebels.
summary: Government forces lost control of Aleppo to the Islamist-dominated rebel alliance for the first time since the conflict began in 2011. The lightning assault was led by Hayat Tahrir al-Sham and coincided with a ceasefire in Lebanon. Kurdish forces expanded their control, exacerbating tensions with the rebels.

title: Trump names daughter Tiffany's father-in-law, Massad Boulos, as senior adviser on Arab and Middle Eastern affairs
content: US President-elect Donald Trump has appointed Lebanese-American businessman Massad Boulos as his senior adviser on Arab and Middle Eastern affairs. Trump praised Boulos as a skilled dealmaker and a staunch advocate for Middle East peace. Boulos, who is Trump's daughter Tiffany’s father-in-law, played a key role in engaging Arab American and Muslim leaders during the campaign.
summary: US President-elect Donald Trump has appointed Lebanese-American businessman Massad Boulos as his senior adviser on Arab and Middle Eastern affairs. Trump praised Boulos as a skilled dealmaker and a staunch advocate for Middle East peace. Boulos, who is Trump's daughter Tiffany’s father-in-law, played a key role in engaging Arab American and Muslim leaders during the campaign.

title: Saudi crown prince visits UAE, Saudi state news agency says
content: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman visited the United Arab Emirates, marking the first such visit in three years. This visit precedes the Dec. 5 OPEC+ oil policy meeting. Key issues include an output hike for the UAE set for January 2025. Saudi and UAE, despite being allies, have had economic differences at times.
summary: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman visited the United Arab Emirates, marking the first such visit in three years. This visit precedes the Dec. 5 OPEC+ oil policy meeting. Key issues include an output hike for the UAE set for January 2025. Saudi and UAE, despite being allies, have had economic differences at times.

title: Trump's homeland security pick Kristi Noem earns praise from border czar Tom Homan
content: Kristi Noem, nominated by President-elect Trump for Homeland Security secretary, is praised by border czar Tom Homan for her readiness to address the migrant crisis. Noem, known for her strict border policies as South Dakota governor, has proposed new strategies and plans to work closely with Homan on tightening border enforcement and accelerating deportations.
summary: Kristi Noem, nominated by President-elect Trump for Homeland Security secretary, is praised by border czar Tom Homan for her readiness to address the migrant crisis. Noem, known for her strict border policies as South Dakota governor, has proposed new strategies and plans to work closely with Homan on tightening border enforcement and accelerating deportations.

title: Bangladesh stops dozens of Iskcon members from crossing into India amid rising tensions
content: Bangladesh's immigration authorities at the Benapole border denied entry to 54 Iskcon members despite valid documents, citing the absence of specific government approval. This follows heightened scrutiny of Iskcon amidst the arrest of Hindu leader Chinmoy Krishna Das and subsequent tension and protests among Hindu minorities in Bangladesh.
summary: Bangladesh's immigration authorities at the Benapole border denied entry to 54 Iskcon members despite valid documents, citing the absence of specific government approval. This follows heightened scrutiny of Iskcon amidst the arrest of Hindu leader Chinmoy Krishna Das and subsequent tension and protests among Hindu minorities in Bangladesh.

title: 8 terrorists, two security personnel killed in two separate operations in Pakistan
content: Eight terrorists and two security personnel, including an officer, were killed in two separate operations in northwest Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province. The terrorists were involved in numerous attacks against security forces and civilians. The operations aimed to eliminate the presence of militants in the area, and the region's chief minister lauded the sacrifices of the security personnel.
summary: Eight terrorists and two security personnel, including an officer, were killed in two separate operations in northwest Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province. The terrorists were involved in numerous attacks against security forces and civilians. The operations aimed to eliminate the presence of militants in the area, and the region's chief minister lauded the sacrifices of the security personnel.

title: Pak sectarian violence: Death toll rises to 130 as clashes continue in Kurram despite ceasefire
content: Sectarian violence in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan, has escalated, with the death toll reaching 130 and 186 injured. Clashes between Alizai and Bagan tribes in Kurram district continue despite ceasefire efforts. The ongoing violence has led to road closures, a communication blackout, and shortages of essentials. Authorities remain hopeful for a truce and reopening of transport routes.
summary: Sectarian violence in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan, has escalated, with the death toll reaching 130 and 186 injured. Clashes between Alizai and Bagan tribes in Kurram district continue despite ceasefire efforts. The ongoing violence has led to road closures, a communication blackout, and shortages of essentials. Authorities remain hopeful for a truce and reopening of transport routes.

title: US man kills 80-year-old 'sneezing' roommate for being 'too close' to food on Thanksgiving
content: A 65-year-old Marshfield man, Richard Lombardi, faces involuntary manslaughter charges after an altercation with his 80-year-old roommate, Frank Griswold, led to Griswold's death. Lombardi allegedly pushed Griswold, causing him to fall and sustain fatal head injuries. Lombardi had previously helped Griswold with daily tasks and they had been roommates since 2001. A dangerousness hearing is scheduled for Dec. 4.
summary: A 65-year-old Marshfield man, Richard Lombardi, faces involuntary manslaughter charges after an altercation with his 80-year-old roommate, Frank Griswold, led to Griswold's death. Lombardi allegedly pushed Griswold, causing him to fall and sustain fatal head injuries. Lombardi had previously helped Griswold with daily tasks and they had been roommates since 2001. A dangerousness hearing is scheduled for Dec. 4.

title: Pope urges Lebanon to elect a new president immediately
content: Pope Francis urged Lebanese politicians to immediately elect a new president to restore the country's governing institutions and initiate necessary reforms. Lebanon has faced a leadership void since October 2022. With elections called for January 9, the pontiff emphasized the need for political consensus to preserve Lebanon's role as a model of peaceful religious coexistence.
summary: Pope Francis urged Lebanese politicians to immediately elect a new president to restore the country's governing institutions and initiate necessary reforms. Lebanon has faced a leadership void since October 2022. With elections called for January 9, the pontiff emphasized the need for political consensus to preserve Lebanon's role as a model of peaceful religious coexistence.

title: Bangladesh court to hear bail plea of Hindu priest Chinmoy Krishna Das on December 3
content: A Bangladesh court will hear Hindu priest Chinmoy Krishna Das's bail plea on December 3. Das was arrested on November 27 for sedition related to hoisting a saffron flag above the national flag. His arrest incited protests and led to the freezing of accounts linked to 17 ISKCON members, amid concerns over violence targeting Hindu minorities.
summary: A Bangladesh court will hear Hindu priest Chinmoy Krishna Das's bail plea on December 3. Das was arrested on November 27 for sedition related to hoisting a saffron flag above the national flag. His arrest incited protests and led to the freezing of accounts linked to 17 ISKCON members, amid concerns over violence targeting Hindu minorities.
